Trending statistics

Get facts and insights on topics that matter

  • Jul 2, 2020 | Diseases

    Average number of COVID-19 deaths in last 7 days in select countries, Mar. 1-June 30

    The average number of deaths from COVID-19 in the United States over the last seven days as of June 30, 2020 was around 820. This statistic shows the average number of deaths from COVID-19 over the last seven days in select countries worldwide from March 1 to June 30, 2020.

    Read more

  • Jul 2, 2020 | Reach & Traffic

    Most-visited health and medicine websites worldwide 2019-2020

    Mayoclinic.org was the most popular health and medicine website with almost 217 million global visits in May 2020, up from 195 million global visits in January 2020. This is of course due to the global coronavirus pandemic which has forced millions of people to stay at home in order to stop the spread of the virus. Health websites experienced a surge of visits as consumers have tried to keep up with current information regarding the COVID-19 outbreak.

    Read more

  • Jul 2, 2020 | Hotels

    COVID-19's effect on hotel KPIs in the U.S. as of June 27, 2020

    The coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic is causing the hotel industry across the globe to take a hit. In the United States, this can be seen through a year-over-year decrease in the most important key performance indicators in the industry: occupancy, revenue per available room (RevPAR), and average daily rate (ADR). In the week ending June 27, U.S. hotels had an occupancy of 46.2 percent, showing a year-over-year decrease of 38.7 percent. Meanwhile, ADR dropped to 95.37 U.S. dollars, reflecting a decrease of 29 percent on the previous year. Lastly, a RevPAR of 44.03 U.S. dollars showed a year-on-year drop of 56.5 percent.

    Read more

  • Jul 2, 2020 | Politics & Government

    Results of the constitutional voting in Russia 2020

    Nearly 78 percent of Russians voted for proposed amendments to the Constitution in a plebiscite from June 25 to July 1, 2020, as stated by the Central Election Committee of the country. In two federal subjects, namely the city of Moscow and the Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, residents could also cast their ballots online. In an online voting, over 40 percent of participants in the Nizhny Novgorod Oblast were against the changes to the document.

    Read more

  • Jun 15, 2020 | Mobile Internet & Apps

    Monthly active users of TikTok in the UK 2017-2020

    TikTok, a social video app which has been a hit with with young people, had over 6 million active users in the month of May 2020 in the United Kingdom, according to Priori Data.

    Read more

  • Aug 30, 2019 | Demographics

    Largest cities in Europe in 2020

    In 2020 Istanbul was the largest city in Europe with an estimated urban agglomeration of 15.9 million people. The Russian capital, Moscow was the second largest city in 2020 at 12.5 million, followed by the capitals of France and the United Kingdom, with Paris at 11 million and London at 9.3 million people. Although both Russia and Turkey have most of their territory in Asia, Istanbul and Moscow are located within Europe, with Istanbul famously straddling both continents Europe’s population almost 750 million Since 1950, the population of Europe has increased by approximately 200 million people, increasing from 550 million to 750 million in this seventy-year period. Prior to the turn of the millennium, Europe was the second-most populated continent, before it was overtaken by Africa, which saw its population increase from 228 million in 1950, to 817 million by 2000. Asia has consistently had the largest population of the world’s continents and was estimated to have a population of 4.6 billion in 2020. Europe’s largest countries Including its territory in Asia, Russia is the by far largest country in the world, with a territory of around 17 million square kilometers, almost double that of the next largest country, Canada. Within Europe, Russia also has the continents largest population at 145 million, followed by Germany at 83 million and the United Kingdom at almost 68 million. By contrast, Europe is also home to various micro-states such as San Marino, which has a population of just 30 thousand.

    Read more
